intro: Cissus verticillata subsp. colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian grape ivy, is a climbing plant native to South America. It features heart-shaped leaves that are often variegated with white and yellow markings. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible, grape-like berries. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. Its rapid growth and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardening.
